org.jfree.experimental.swt

Class SWTGraphics2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Graphics
      • java.awt.Graphics2D
        • org.jfree.experimental.swt.SWTGraphics2D

  • public class SWTGraphics2D
extends java.awt.Graphics2D
    This is a class utility to draw Graphics2D stuff on a swt composite. It is presently developed to use JFreeChart with the Standard Widget Toolkit but may be of a wider use later.

    • Field Detail

      • gc

        private org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC gc
        The swt graphic composite

      • hints

        private java.awt.RenderingHints hints
        The rendering hints. For now, these are not used, but at least the basic mechanism is present.

      • composite

        private java.awt.Composite composite
        A reference to the compositing rule to apply. This is necessary due to the poor compositing interface of the SWT toolkit.

      • colorsPool

        private java.util.Map colorsPool
        A HashMap to store the Swt color resources.

      • fontsPool

        private java.util.Map fontsPool
        A HashMap to store the Swt font resources.

      • transformsPool

        private java.util.Map transformsPool
        A HashMap to store the Swt transform resources.

      • resourcePool

        private java.util.List resourcePool
        A List to store the Swt resources.

        private java.awt.Color backgroundColor

                    java.lang.Object hintValue)

        Specified by:

        public void setPaint(java.awt.Paint paint)

      • drawRoundRect

        Draws a rectangle with rounded corners that fits within the specified framing rectangle.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Releases resources held by this instance (but note that the caller must dispose of the 'GC' passed to the constructor).
        Specified by:
        dispose in class java.awt.Graphics
        See Also:
        Graphics.dispose()

      • addToResourcePool

        private org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Resource addToResourcePool(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Resource resource)
        Add given swt resource to the resource pool. All resources added to the resource pool will be disposed when dispose() is called.
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource to add to the pool.
        Returns:
        the swt Resource just added.

      • disposeResourcePool

        private void disposeResourcePool()
        Dispose the resource pool.

      • getSwtFontFromPool

        private org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Font getSwtFontFromPool(java.awt.Font font)
        Internal method to convert a AWT font object into a SWT font resource. If a corresponding SWT font instance is already in the pool, it will be used instead of creating a new one. This is used in #setFont() for instance.
        Parameters:
        font - The AWT font to convert.
        Returns:
        The SWT font instance.

      • getSwtColorFromPool

        private org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color getSwtColorFromPool(java.awt.Color awtColor)
        Internal method to convert a AWT color object into a SWT color resource. If a corresponding SWT color instance is already in the pool, it will be used instead of creating a new one. This is used in #setColor() for instance.
        Parameters:
        awtColor - The AWT color to convert.
        Returns:
        A SWT color instance.

      • getSwtTransformFromPool

        private org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Transform getSwtTransformFromPool(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform awtTransform)
        Internal method to convert a AWT transform object into a SWT transform resource. If a corresponding SWT transform instance is already in the pool, it will be used instead of creating a new one. This is used in #setTransform() for instance.
        Parameters:
        awtTransform - The AWT transform to convert.
        Returns:
        A SWT transform instance.

      • switchColors

        private void switchColors()
        Perform a switch between foreground and background color of gc. This is needed for consistency with the awt behaviour, and is required notably for the filling methods.

        shape - the shape (null not permitted).

        The path.
